options.title: -d
options.description: Causes system to create a dump before rebooting. This option is useful for debugging system dump procedures or capturing the state of a corrupted or misbehaving system. See savecore(8) for information on how to recover this dump.

options.title: -n
options.description: Prevent file system cache from being flushed. This option should probably not be used.

options.title: -p
options.description: Causes the system to power down, if it is being halted, and the hardware supports automatic power down.

options.title: -q
options.description: Quick. The system is halted or restarted quickly and ungracefully, and only the flushing of the file system cache is performed. This option should probably not be used.
